thread.title: Chelsea manager Antonio Conte wants to give John Terry perfect send off

author: John Percy
title: Chelsea manager Antonio Conte wants to give John Terry perfect send off
text:
Chelsea manager Antonio Conte wants to give John Terry perfect send off Terry made only his eighth start of the season at Wolves Credit: Getty Images John Percy  30pm 
J ohn Terry’s 22-year association with Chelsea could finally be over this summer but the prospect of a fitting denouement is inching ever closer. 
Terry’s hopes of lifting the Premier League trophy and the FA Cup are still in his grasp ahead of the annual uncertainty over whether the defender will earn a new contract. 
The 36-year-old has made so many comebacks during his career at Stamford Bridge but there is now an increasing sense that the old warrior’s time is coming to an end, with Antonio Conte scouring Europe for a newer model. 
Terry made only his eighth start under Conte in Saturday’s victory at Wolverhampton Wanderers yet the dream scenario of him signing off with Chelsea’s first double since 2010 is there and, for the cynics, possibly a convenient way to part company. 
Conte is giving nothing away on Terry’s future at this stage but when asked for his thoughts on Chelsea’s captain lifting the FA Cup at the end of the season, the answer was revealing. Chelsea ran out comfortable 2-0 winner at Wolves Credit: Rex Features 
“I’d sign now for this. Now I’d sign,” he said, smiling and signing in the air with a flourish. 
“The most important thing is now, the present, to work and build a good future. Then, yes, for sure we will see the situation of every single player and we try to make the best decision for every single player. 
“I’m pleased to give him the opportunity to play but not because there is a sentiment. 
“I think John Terry deserved to play this game and he played very well, I’m very happy for him. For me, he’s a very important player, my captain and he’s important on and off the pitch. He’s helping me a lot, and I’m very pleased to have him in my squad and also to know this type of person.” 
T erry will consider his next move at the end of the season and Chelsea do not expect to address the situation until May. Conte was pleased with his captain's performance Credit: Rex Features 
H e is not ready to retire just yet, despite taking his coaching badges, but has always dismissed the idea of playing for another Premier League club. Bournemouth made an attempt to sign him on loan in January and did not receive any encouragement. 
Asmir Begovic, the goalkeeper, said: “He trains like he always has. What he’s got in his mind is only something he can answer. 
“I can see him continuing to play and I don’t see why he should quit but maybe if he lifts two trophies that’s a great way to go out as well.” FA Cup quarter-final draw 
C helsea have not won the double since Carlo Ancelotti’s time at the club and will be difficult to stop this season. Conte made seven changes at Molineux yet this was still another ruthlessly efficient performance. 
Wolves produced an energetic, vibrant first-half performance which unsettled the Premier League leaders with George Saville, the former Chelsea midfielder, striking the post early on. 
Yet Wolves struggled to match that intensity in the second period and Chelsea exploited the gaps to ensure they did not join Liverpool and Stoke in the list of Paul Lambert’s victims. Watch | FA Cup: Wolves vs Chelsea - all the key stats 00:45 
P edro provided the clinical finish to a fine counter-attack in the 65 th minute to put Chelsea ahead before Diego Costa pounced with his 16 th goal of the season just before the final whistle. 
Lambert, the Wolves manager, will now need to focus on fulfilling his survival mission yet should have no problems on this performance. 
“The team has benefited because of the calibre of team we’ve played – Stoke, Liverpool and now Chelsea,” he said. 
“I’ve never know a cup run to get three Premier teams on the bounce so it’s been tough but we’ll come out of it with a lot of credit, hopefully that we deserve. All we need to do now is take it on to the league.”
